column4: /dists/gutsy/main/binary-i386/Packages.gz file failed the MD5 burnt at 8x, the lowest my burner can burn at.. stil lthe same error
what media you using to burn--brand?
i used 1 melody DVD r, then 3 rammeda cd-r
what are you using to burn --program?
using disk utility found in Mac osx
that is odd; that utility is very reliable
md5 sum error? you are getting that?
that means the iso is corrupted
: i wonder if they made changes in the Packages.gz file and forgot to update the md5sum.txt file?
can't be... coz the iso matches the md5 hash found on release.ubuntu site
if you are getting md5 errors the iso is corrupted and needs to be redownloaded
i calculated the md5 sum locally, it does give me the correct sum as found on the server here
there is a corrupt file somewhere in there
either that or the media as disk utility is not at fault
we all do
how about burning another linux iso and eliminate media as a source of error, like dsl or puppy linux then try booting from that
: that would be worth a try
once you do that then you can know if it is media or corrupted iso file
okie, but explain to me the logic behind a matching hash, but corrupted file?
have you tried downloading another iso to test out?

with my current internet speed, i'll take me more than 1 day to fetch a new iso, and i need to develop my univ project before the end of friday.. and i am already late on schedule thanks for my self over estimation
then dsl or puppy linux which are around 30-40 MB
how about the minimal iso? it is only 9MB
then you can net install the rest as you wish
